info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 6:33AM CDT until March 27 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron.
* WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rancho Viejo, Cameron Park, Port Of Brownsville, Southmost, Downtown Brownsville, Olmito, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, Gallegos Elementary School, Gonzalez Elementary School, Vela Middle School, Brownsville Event Center, Perkins Middle School, Brownsville Fire Department Station Six, Northside Transfer Station, Hanna High School, Brownsville Golf Center, Rivera High School, B I S D Administration Building and Sunrise Mall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING
